title: How to Make a Cookie Pizza

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to the temperature specified on the sugar cookie package directions.
Spray nonstick cooking spray on a pan that is appropriate for your cookie pizza.
steps.description: If you want a rectangular pizza, then choose a rectangular baking stone or baking sheet. If you prefer circular pizza, then choose a pizza pan or a round baking stone.

steps.headline: Sprinkle some flour on some wax paper or on a work surface.
Place the dough on top and roll it out to the desired thickness and shape using a rolling pin.
Place the dough on your baking pan, trimming off any excess dough with a chef’s knife.
steps.description: You can reserve the excess dough for another purpose like adding it to vanilla ice cream, or you can discard it.

steps.headline: Bake the dough according to the package directions.
steps.description: Then, remove it from the oven and allow it to cool completely on the stovetop.

steps.headline: Transfer the cookie onto your serving plate.
Mix the marshmallow cream and yogurt together in a medium bowl with a whisk until they are well combined.
Using an offset spatula, spread the marshmallow cream and yogurt mixture over the surface of the cooled cookie dough.
Place the fruit toppings on top of your pizza in any pattern that you desire.
steps.description: You can scatter the fruit topping, assemble each fruit in its own row or create any combination that you desire.

steps.headline: Slice the cookie pizza with a pizza cutter and serve.

text: Bake the Dough Preheat your oven to the temperature specified on the sugar cookie package directions.  Spray nonstick cooking spray on a pan that is appropriate for your cookie pizza. If you want a rectangular pizza, then choose a rectangular baking stone or baking sheet. If you prefer circular pizza, then choose a pizza pan or a round baking stone. Sprinkle some flour on some wax paper or on a work surface.  Place the dough on top and roll it out to the desired thickness and shape using a rolling pin.  Place the dough on your baking pan, trimming off any excess dough with a chef’s knife. You can reserve the excess dough for another purpose like adding it to vanilla ice cream, or you can discard it. Bake the dough according to the package directions. Then, remove it from the oven and allow it to cool completely on the stovetop. Prepare the Toppings Transfer the cookie onto your serving plate.  Mix the marshmallow cream and yogurt together in a medium bowl with a whisk until they are well combined.  Using an offset spatula, spread the marshmallow cream and yogurt mixture over the surface of the cooled cookie dough.  Place the fruit toppings on top of your pizza in any pattern that you desire. You can scatter the fruit topping, assemble each fruit in its own row or create any combination that you desire. Slice the cookie pizza with a pizza cutter and serve.  Finished.
